result.execSummary:
The defendant David Q Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Restitution set at $0. 
Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.
No contact with Hope A., and E.T.L unless approved by agent.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he  may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (26 pages) JURY TRIAL commencing 01-04-2016 received and filed.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 30 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR consecutive to 14CF5054. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention Program
-Mental health assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No contact with Hope A., and E.T.L unless approved by agent
-Obtain employment
-Obtain GED
-No contact with firearms

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he  may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
 Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1, 3, 4 and 5 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on COUNT 2.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 2  as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Received and Filed, Motion in Limine- Defense.
Received and Filed, Defense Witness List.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Case remains set for Jury Trial on 1/4/2015 at 8:30am.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant David Q Patterson not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Counsel informed Court he has a medical issue and will be on leave.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  The 10/12/15 jury trial is vacated.s  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant was not produced.  Case set over to 9/16/15 at 8:30 am.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. State REVOKED offer. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Curt Rogers in court via telephone, defendant David Q Patterson not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared on behalf of Benjamin Lindsay for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Arraignment. Defense requests an adjourned date. Court granted defense request. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Arraignment scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Original Transcript (17 pages) commencing 06-19-2015, PRELIMINARY HEARING (15CF001756) RETURN ON BENCH WARRANT AND BAIL HEARING (14CF005054) MOTION FOR SUBSTITUTION OF JUDGE (BOTH CASES) received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Steven Holmblad.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Case adjourned for an Arraignment. State's motion for joinder of 15CF1756 & 14CF5054, GRANTED.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Arraignment scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERS NO CONTACT/NO FIREARMS.

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is called on the record at approximately 11:10 a.m.
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
State informs the Court that ADA Lindsay was notified and would be bringing ADA file to court.  Defense Counsel unable to remain in court any longer due to previously scheduled appointment.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled  substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hope A or her children and Reginald B

Defendant David Q Patterson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant David Q Patterson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 4 & 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
